newsitem.title: UK: Low & Bonar sinks after profit warning.
newsitem.headline: Low & Bonar sinks after profit warning.

text.p: Shares in packaging and plastics group Low & Bonar Plc topped the losers list in London on Tuesday, shedding over 13 percent after the company issued a current year profit warning.
The shares had fallen 73p to 486p by 1115 GMT after initially falling 89p to a low of 468p. Volume had reached over one million shares.
Earlier the company said weaker-than-expected trading conditions at its silage wrap and North American packaging operations would affect current year profitability.
But analysts said the share price reaction to the trading statement had been overdone.
"The reaction seems harsh, the statement in itself didn't warrant 15 percent off the market capitalisation," said one industry analyst who declined to be named.
"It came as a shock," he said. "But in terms of profits, it was a five or six percent shock."
